content.description: Featured climbing on tan rock leads to a steep grey cap.  Clip, crank past the crux, and make a few delicate moves up to the anchors.
content.location:
Find the Mushroom formation at the far left end of the Bank.  From

On the Mushroom

walk right until you find a trail branching up left into an alcove with 5 new routes.  Will Purr For Treats follows a fin of rock on the left wall of the alcove (right-most route on the left wall).  The route to the left follows large ledges.  One route to the right tackles steep pockets. Two routes to the right takes on a technical face with a crux bulge in the middle.  The farthest right route shimmies up the chimney formed by the front and right walls.

climbs.name: They Only Come Out At Night

content.description: Somewhat committing moves lead to a fairly high first bolt. After the second clip, make an easy but dirty mantel (it will clean up with traffic). Clip the third bolt, and ascend the crux mantel just left of a small pine tree. Face climbing on sharp holds leads to the anchors.
Face climbing and stemming will get you up a series of three large ledges.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the pillar of the alcove between the

Neopolitain Headrush

alcove and

Dave Dangle

wall.

content.description: Start beneath the obvious, scary boulder and clamber up on to it from the left side. Make a couple cruxy reaches off of the boulder, and cruise to the top following the crack. The majority of this route, excluding the belay, remains in the shade until midday.
content.location: On the separate, roofed panel of rock to the right of the Bank Rob area, this is the first bolted line on the left. Scarface starts beneath a scary boulder, climbs over it, and finishes in the left-facing corner above.

content.description:
This route is listed in Bob D's new guidebook as Stewart's Slab.  Start on the right side of a vertical brown wall.  Pull through finger pockets and crimps past a slight bulge and finish up and left on easier terrain, to a two-bolt anchor below a big roof, shared with

Black Hole Sun

.  Rappel to descend.
content.location:
This is the second bolted line to the right of

On the Mushroom

.

content.description: This route is a 3 bolt shorty with stone like the Dark Side. It is barely worth it if you're looking for a short 11. Also, it is easily topped out if you want to experience the rock spikes.
content.location: This route is set up on the hill near the cave with the white streak. Get to the cave, and look right. On the face is On the Ritz.

content.description:
To find this route, hike west from the back to the [Future Area] for several hundred yards.  As you are hiking along the trail, keep an eye out for the [Mushroom Dome] formation that is the lower part of the route.  You will definitely know it when you see it because it is very unique.  It is route number 2 on [William Prehm's Neopolitan Headrush] area photo.

Begin face climbing up the [Mushroom Dome] on good pockets, past 2 bolts and a slightly difficult move or two.  The route then traverses a bit left to a small steep corner.  Crank like a banshee through this section and 3 bolts into a weird off balance blocky section.  The next bolt is way up to the left under the roof.  This section of climbing isn't mega tough, but it isn't easy and you will probably be carrying a substantial pump.  I would possibly give this section an 'R' rating, because if you come off you will probably eat the big ledge below you.  Make sure your belayer is ready to head for [Canon City] (meaning running belay to the south) if you do come off.  Once you get the  bolt under the roof clipped you can shake your pump out and deal with the stout boulder problem finish.  Crank pretty freakin' hard over the roof and keep looking up and to the left.  The anchors are difficult to see, but sometimes they have webbing on them.  Either bring some webbing and a ring to rap with, or you can hike to the west about a 100 yards and down a [gully] to the trail.
content.protection: 7 bolts to hard to find 3 bolt anchor.

content.description:
The crux comes right off the deck, so expect some tricky belaying with belayer and climber becoming intimate, better yet stick clip the second bolt.

After working out the pockets and crimps of the lower crux, cruise up to the shelf for a comfortable rest (or nap if it's sunny and warm). Clip the bolt and crank out of the roof.

Like the lower sequence, the roof here takes some vision to work out. Unlike the multiple choice questions on other Shelf climbs where deciding which chalked hold is the best, on NH deciding which unchalked hold that you may or may not see right now is best?

The route is a little short by shelf standards and the two cruxes are separated by a easy to achieve no hands rest, yet the route has very interesting moves on quality rock. Deserves more ascents than it appears to receive.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the bank in a less visited small amphitheatre of rock, Neapolitan Headrush climbs the furthest left bolted route.

content.description: Climb the sharp pocketed reddish face for 2 clips to an okay stance at the protruding block on the left at C3. Continuous, steep climbing on good holds past C3 with big, flat ledges and cruxy pulls at a tiered section puts you past C5 with a final hard pull past C6. At C6, a short run will get you to the anchors.
content.location:
At

Bank Rob Right

, it is in between

Scarface

and

Lynch Mob

.

content.description: Stemming is the name of the game on this route.  Scramble up easy rock to a high first bolt while keeping your eyes peeled for a bulge at the third bolt.  Stem or crank your way through this to gain easier ground.  Above you will be a system of three cracks where optional jams and mandatory stemming will deposit you at the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts to two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Find the alcove that is home to

Will Purr For Treats

and 4 other climbs.  From here walk right for about 20 yards (around an obvious bulge) aiming for a recess in the wall.  A high first bolt in tan rock is the first of eight bolts that lead you to the anchors in the black cap rock.

content.description: Stem and chimney up the wide crack/corner on the right side of the alcove.
content.location:
On the right side of the alcove, start approximately 15 right of

1979

.

content.description: Scramble over a couple of ledges to reach the base of the tan wall.  Work up past three bolts on delicate holds to a black overhanging dihedral.  Stances are a bit awkward here.  Turn the bulge right of the bolt line while making the fourth clip.  Run up to the second roof on easier ground and clip the last bolt.  Take the roof head-on and fire up to jugs just below the anchor.  Footwork is key!  Rappel to descend.
content.location:
Goodfellas is about 20 or 30 feet left of

On the Mushroom

and resides on a separate wall, maybe 100 to the right of the Bank Rob Wall.

content.description:
A little bit steeper and more bouldery than your typical Shelf route. Begin with right hand on a small crimp sidepull at shoulder height. Jump your left hand for the obvious large pocket. Pull up on good rails and easy climbing to the ledge just below the roof. From there, it's a reachy move over the bulge to an awkward pull to get up on the slab. As with

Neapolitan Headrush

, it's fun moves on good rock that leaves you wanting more!
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Stick clipping first bolt is recommended.
content.location:
Located on the right side of the

Neapolitan Headrush

Alcove.

content.description:
Start in the middle of a vertical, brown wall.  Nice pockets and crimps take you to the first clip.  The crux is working up on delicate feet and less than desirable hands, past a slight bulge.  Finish straight up on easier, yet sometimes delicate, terrain, to a two-bolt anchor below a big roof, shared with

Razor Burn (aka Stewart's Slab)

.  Rappel to descend.
content.location:
This is the first bolted line to the right of

On the Mushroom

.

content.description: Start up the lower angle brown slab with great pockets to reach the first clip.  Fire up the overhanging section on big jugs, passing four more bolts; dont stop, theres a good rest right under the big roof.  Clip the next bolt and take on the crux: traversing right below the roof, then up to a great hand.  Cruise jugs to the anchor.  This route is real dusty; just needs to see more traffic!  Rappel to descend.
content.location:
Lynch Mob is the rightmost of three bolt lines on a smaller, separate wall about 30 yds to the right of Bank Rob wall and about 20 to the left of

Goodfellas

.

content.description: The crux comes right off the ground with a couple bouldery moves on pockets to the left side of a ledge.  Move up to a shake out stance, puzzle through a couple more moves, and hit the anchors.
content.location:
This is the left hand route in the back of the alcove, approximately 20 feet right of

Will Purr for Treats

.
